overview_summary: Neighboring landowners include a regional homebuilding developer, an agricultural storage company, two large residential homeowner associations, and a private family trust. The developer’s holdings suggest potential competition or alternative plans, while the HOA communities (totaling around 1,000 homes) could mobilize significant local opposition. The Virginia-based cold storage firm connects to a prominent apple-growing family, indicating agricultural interests that might be sensitive to environmental impacts. Overall, neighbors range from profit-driven speculators to well-organized community groups, each with distinct motivations and influence.

neighbors.name: Dr Acquisitions Llc
neighbors.claims: DR Acquisitions LLC is a West Virginia limited liability company formed on July 29, 2004, with a stated purpose of residential building construction [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=228584). State filings list Dan Ryan of Frederick, Maryland as the sole managing member of the LLC [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=228584). The company’s mailing and office address (64 Thomas Johnson Dr, Frederick) corresponds to the headquarters of Dan Ryan Builders, linking the entity to a major regional homebuilder [Cortera Company Profile](https://start.cortera.com/company/research/m0n0ltl0p/dr-acquisitions-llc/). DR Acquisitions LLC owns multiple parcels in Jefferson County (including the PINs above), indicating land holdings likely intended for future housing development or investment.
neighbors.influence_justification: Regional homebuilder ownership; controls local development land; moderate political presence but significant economic stake

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage principal Dan Ryan directly to discuss mutually beneficial outcomes or land acquisition; address how the project can align with or compensate his planned housing development to mitigate opposition

neighbors.name: Winchester Cold Storage Co Inc
neighbors.claims: Winchester Cold Storage Company, Inc. is a Virginia-based cold logistics and orchard company that registered to do business in West Virginia in March 2002 as a foreign profit corporation [WV Corporate Records](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-wv/winchester-cold-storage-company--206926). The firm was originally established in 1917 by Harry F. Byrd to serve the apple industry, reflecting a century-old agricultural heritage in the region [WCS Logistics](https://wcslogistics.com/timeline/). Its current officers include John Scully IV (President) and Harry F. Byrd III (Vice-President), members of prominent fruit-growing families in the Winchester area [WV Corporate Records](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-wv/winchester-cold-storage-company--206926). The company’s land in Jefferson County is likely used for orchard operations or land investment, and there is no public record of the corporation taking positions on local development projects.
neighbors.influence_justification: Significant farmland owner; ties to influential regional family (Byrd); moderate economic role (agriculture) but limited direct local engagement

approach_recommendations.engage: Initiate dialogue with company executives (e.g. Harry Byrd III) emphasizing environmental protections and potential benefits to agricultural interests; offer assurances that the project will not harm orchard operations or land value

neighbors.name: Tuscawilla Hills Citizens Association Inc
neighbors.claims: Tuscawilla Hills Citizens Association Inc is the homeowners’ association for the Tuscawilla Hills subdivision, incorporated in West Virginia on January 30, 1976 as a domestic non-profit corporation [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=29509). The community comprises over 500 residential units (single-family homes, townhomes, duplexes) located just outside Charles Town and adjacent to the Locust Hill golf course development [Kable Team Realty – Tuscawilla](https://www.kableteam.com/neighborhood/tuscawilla). The HOA’s official addresses are c/o Clagett Management in Martinsburg, WV, indicating it is professionally managed on behalf of the residents [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=29509). The association is governed by local homeowner volunteers (e.g., a resident of Tuscawilla Drive is listed as a director in state filings), but it has no recorded history of direct political activity beyond neighborhood issues.
neighbors.influence_justification: Represents ~500 households; can mobilize residents in public hearings; primarily focuses on neighborhood concerns

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the HOA board via its management company to address residents’ concerns; provide presentations or assurances (landscaping buffers, minimal disturbance) to maintain goodwill among the Tuscawilla Hills community

neighbors.name: Turner B Guilford & Linda S-Tr
neighbors.claims: This entry appears to be a private family trust holding property (identified by individual names Turner B. Guilford and Linda S.), rather than a business or organization. No corporate or public records are available for this trust; see the RESIDENT table for details on the individuals involved.
neighbors.influence_justification: Individual landowners; influence depends on personal local ties and resources, which are not publicly documented

approach_recommendations.engage: Treat as individual landowners: engage the trustees personally to understand their concerns or interest in the project; consider offering fair compensation or accommodations if their property is impacted

neighbors.name: Locust Hill Unitowner'S Association Inc
neighbors.claims: Locust Hill Unitowner’s Association Inc is the homeowners’ association for the Locust Hill golf-course community, organized in West Virginia on October 22, 1990 as a domestic non-profit corporation [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=132879). The Locust Hill neighborhood consists of roughly 500 homes surrounding an 18-hole golf course in Charles Town, WV, making it one of the larger residential developments in the county [Kable Team Realty – Locust Hill](https://www.kableteam.com/neighborhood/locust-hill). Like Tuscawilla, this HOA is managed by Clagett Management Services, and its registered agent (Heather Field) and office are listed at Clagett’s Martinsburg address [WV Secretary of State](https://apps.sos.wv.gov/business/corporations/organization.aspx?org=132879). The association has demonstrated willingness to use legal action to enforce its covenants (e.g., it pursued an injunction in 2024 against a resident’s prohibited sign display), indicating it is an active and organized community entity [Intermediate Court of Appeals of WV](https://law.justia.com/cases/west-virginia/intermediate-court-of-appeals/2025/24-ICA-270.html).
neighbors.influence_justification: Large upscale subdivision (~500 families); organized HOA with legal counsel; capable of galvanizing residents in land-use disputes

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Locust Hill HOA board (through its management or counsel) early to discuss project plans; offer community benefits or assurances (e.g., visual buffers, noise reduction, infrastructure improvements) to mitigate the residents’ concerns and preempt organized opposition
